t: Exodus 15
Israel’s Song
Then*p Moses and the Israelites sang this song to the Lord.*s They said: I*pn will sing to the Lord,*s for*ln he is highly exalted; he*ln has thrown the horse and*ln its rider into the sea.
The*ln Lord*s is my strength and my song; he*ln has become my salvation. This*ln is my God, and I will praise him, my*ln father’s God, and I will exalt him.
The*ln Lord*s is a warrior; the*ln Lord*s is his name.
He*pn threw Pharaoh’s chariots and*ln his army into the sea; the*ln elite of his officers were*ln drowned in the Red Sea.
The*ln floods covered them; they*ln sank to the depths like a stone.
Lord,*sln your right hand is glorious in power. Lord,*sln your right hand shattered the enemy.
You*ln overthrew your adversaries by*ln your great majesty. You*ln unleashed your burning wrath; it*ln consumed them like stubble.
The*ln water heaped up at the blast from your nostrils; the*ln currents stood firm like a dam. The*ln watery depths congealed in the heart of the sea.
The*ln enemy said: “I*ln will pursue, I will overtake, I*ln will divide the spoil. My*ln desire will be gratified at their expense. I*ln will draw my sword; my*ln hand will destroy them.”
But*ln you blew with your breath, and*ln the sea covered them. They*ln sank like lead in*ln the mighty waters.
Lord,*spn who is like you among the gods? Who*ln is like you, glorious in holiness, revered*ln with praises, performing wonders?
You*ln stretched out your right hand, and*ln the earth swallowed them.
With*ln your faithful love, you*ln will lead the people you*ln have redeemed; you*ln will guide them to your holy dwelling with*ln your strength.
When*pn the peoples hear, they will shudder; anguish*ln will seize the inhabitants of Philistia.
Then*ln the chiefs of Edom will be terrified; trembling*ln will seize the leaders of Moab; all*ln the inhabitants of Canaan will panic;
terror*ln and dread will fall on them. They*ln will be as still as a stone because*ln of your powerful arm until*ln your people pass by, Lord,*s until*ln the people whom you purchased pass by.
You*pn will bring them in and plant them on*ln the mountain of your possession; Lord,*sln you have prepared the place for*ln your dwelling; Lord,*ln your hands have established the sanctuary.
The*ln Lord*s will reign forever and ever!
When*p Pharaoh’s horses with his chariots and horsemen went into the sea, the Lord*s brought the water of the sea back over them. But the Israelites walked through the sea on dry ground.
Then the prophetess Miriam, Aaron’s sister, took a tambourine in her hand, and all the women came out following her with tambourines and dancing.
Miriam sang to them: Sing*pn to the Lord,*s for*ln he is highly exalted; he*ln has thrown the horse and*ln its rider into the sea.
Water Provided
Then*p Moses led Israel on from the Red Sea, and they went out to the Wilderness of Shur. They journeyed for three days in the wilderness without finding water.
They came to Marah, but they could not drink the water at Marah because it was bitter - that is why it was named Marah.
The people grumbled to Moses, “What are we going to drink?”

So he cried out to the Lord,*s and the Lord*s showed him a tree. When he threw it into the water, the water became drinkable. The*p Lord*s made a statute and ordinance for them at Marah, and he tested them there.

He said, “If you will carefully obey the Lord*s your God, do what is right in his sight, pay attention to his commands, and keep all his statutes, I will not inflict any illnesses on you that I inflicted on the Egyptians. For I am the Lord*s who heals you.”
Then*p they came to Elim, where there were twelve springs and seventy date palms, and they camped there by the water.
